Hydroxyl (OH) radicals scavenging activity of TT was determined using the method described by Adjimani and Asare [ 41]. It is based on the ability of phytocompound to scavenge OH radicals by donating an electron to the radical molecule [ 39]. The Fenton reaction mixture was prepared by adding 0.2 mL FeSO 4.7H 2O (10 mM), 0.2 mL EDTA (10 mM), 0.2 mL 2-deoxyribose (10 mM) and 1.2 mL phosphate buffer (0.1 M, pH 7.4). Then, 0.2 mL of different concentrations of TT or mannitol (12.5 μg/mL – 100 μg/mL) were added, followed by the addition of 0.2 mL hydrogen peroxide (10 mM) and incubated for 4 h at 37 ºC. To the incubated mixture, TCA (1 mL, 2.8 % w/v) and TBA (1 mL, 1 % w/v) were added and further incubated in boiling water for 10 min. Thereafter, it was allowed to cool at room temperature and then, centrifuged at 4000 rpm for 4 min. A control reference that contained all solution except TT for baseline correction was used. The absorbance (Abs) was measured at 532 nm against a blank solution.
